story_title: national ice cream day america history
original_story: [excited] Can you believe that in 1984, President Reagan declared July as National Ice Cream Month? This sweet celebration kicks off on the third Sunday of July! Get this—Reagan was a huge fan, and he wanted to promote dairy farmers. Ice cream consumption skyrocketed; Americans indulge in around 23 pounds per person annually! That's roughly 50 million gallons consumed on this day alone. With flavors ranging from classic vanilla to wild lavender, it’s a day dedicated to joy. So, what's your favorite scoop?
